courses.title: Full Stack QA Engineering
courses.subtitle: Manual + automation + frameworks — everything from basics to advanced testing tools.
courses.description: This program is designed to provide complete QA Engineering training, covering both manual and automated testing from beginner to advanced levels. Students will gain hands-on experience in continuous test automation using the Cucumber Test Automation Framework with Java and Selenium. The course also focuses on Agile/Scrum methodologies, ensuring learners understand industry best practices.
courses.overview_description: QA engineers with full stack testing expertise are in high demand in today’s tech-driven world. This course equips you with the skills to ensure product quality and reliability across all stages of development.

course_structure_overview.student_dashboard: Each student receives a personalized dashboard to track classes, study materials, and progress throughout the course.
course_structure_overview.online_live_classes: Attend interactive live classes online from the comfort of your home, with opportunities to engage and ask questions in real time.
course_structure_overview.class_recordings: If you miss a session, recorded classes are available so you can review and stay up to date with the course content.
course_structure_overview.resume_building: Our training includes guidance on building a professional resume to help you stand out and secure your target job.
course_structure_overview.interview_preparation: We provide comprehensive interview preparation, helping you gain the confidence and skills needed to succeed in job interviews.
course_structure_overview.easy_enrollment: Registering for this program is quick and simple—your dream job is just a few clicks away.

what_you_will_learn: QA Fundamentals – Build a strong foundation in QA principles and learn to design effective testing strategies that enhance software quality.
Manual Testing – Understand core manual testing techniques to detect and resolve bugs early in the development cycle.
Automation Testing – Master automation with Selenium and JUnit, streamlining repetitive tests for efficiency and consistency.
API Testing – Learn to validate backend functionality and service communication using Postman.
Performance & Load Testing – Gain experience with JMeter to measure application stability under different workloads.
Database Testing – Apply SQL to verify data accuracy and integrity across application states.
CI/CD Integration – Explore continuous integration and deployment practices, integrating testing into DevOps workflows.
Real-World Projects – Work on hands-on projects that simulate industry challenges in testing complex applications.
Industry Readiness – Stay updated with modern QA trends and methodologies to remain adaptable in an evolving tech landscape.

topics: Phases of SDLC (Requirement, Design, Development, Testing, Deployment, Maintenance)
Waterfall vs Agile vs Iterative models
Role of QA in different SDLC phases
Requirement analysis, Test planning, Test case design, Environment setup

courses.title: Basic Computing Course
courses.subtitle: Learn essential computer skills from scratch—hardware, Windows, applications, and networking.
courses.description: Get hands-on with computers—even if it’s your very first time! The Basic Computing Course at Transfotech Academy is designed for beginners, covering everything from understanding computer parts to navigating Windows, managing files, and connecting to the internet. With step-by-step lessons on organizing files, personalizing desktops, and using essential programs, you’ll build the confidence to work independently in any digital environment. This course is ideal for anyone new to technology or looking to refresh their computing skills, providing a strong foundation for success in today’s digital world.
courses.overview_description: This course is designed for absolute beginners—perfect if you’ve never used a computer before. Even regular computer users will discover new skills and insights. It also serves as a prerequisite for advanced computer courses.

course_structure_overview.hands_on_video_lectures: Learn essential computer skills and Windows navigation through easy-to-follow video lessons.
course_structure_overview.digital_guidebook: Access a comprehensive guidebook with all the key resources you’ll need to strengthen your computing knowledge.
course_structure_overview.dedicated_support_group: Stay connected with peers, share experiences, and receive additional support and resources.
course_structure_overview.weekly_live_qa_classes: Join live Zoom sessions with expert instructors to ask questions, solve problems, and reinforce learning.

whats_included: Interactive Quiz Sets for Hands-On Learning
what_you_will_learn: Understand computer hardware – Identify the physical components of a computer and their functions.
Navigate Windows with confidence – Master personalization, settings, and desktop tools.
Manage files and folders – Create, rename, move, and delete files efficiently.
Work with common applications – Learn how to open, save, and close essential programs.
Grasp networking basics – Discover how servers and networks function.
Use peripheral devices – Connect and manage printers, USB drives, and other devices.
Explore Windows Explorer – Organize files with libraries and understand window structures.
Apply practical exercises – Reinforce skills with hands-on practice for real-world readiness.

topics: Understanding what a computer is and how it works
Types of computers and their uses
Start menu, search bar, and settings
Connecting and using USB drives, printers, and scanners
Safe browsing practices and cybersecurity basics

courses.subtitle: From spreadsheets to machine learning — become a data-informed decision maker.
courses.description: Stay ahead of the curve with real-world cybersecurity skills designed for today’s AI-powered threat landscape. Whether you're entering the field or upskilling, this course prepares you for offensive and defensive security — with hands-on labs, industry tools, and expert instruction.
courses.overview_description: Cybersecurity Engineering with Generative AI equips you with the most up-to-date tools, frameworks, and techniques used by cybersecurity professionals today.
course_structure_overview: Build deep expertise in penetration testing, threat detection, and security architecture.
Attend the Data Analytics & AI program online at your convenience. All sessions are live and interactive for deeper learning.
Missed a class? Don’t worry. You’ll have full access to session recordings so you can catch up anytime.
A sharp resume opens doors. Our course includes guidance to help you create a strong, targeted resume for data roles.
Interviews are critical to landing the right job. We’ll prepare you with mock sessions, tips, and best practices.
Registering is simple and fast. Start your journey into Data Analytics & AI in just a few easy steps.
whats_included: Weekly Quizzes for Practical Skill Testing
Live Q&A and Troubleshooting with Industry Pros
Lifetime Access to All Course Resources
what_you_will_learn: Think Like a Security Professional: Grasp attacker vs defender strategies, risk models, the CIA triad, and the principles that shape cybersecurity today.
System & OS Security: Gain hands-on skills in Linux (Kali) and Windows environments, plus security scripting and asset management.
Master Network Security: Learn firewalls, encryption, IDS/IPS, traffic analysis with Wireshark, and VPN configuration.
Offensive Security Skills (Red Team): Ethically exploit systems using tools like Metasploit and Burp Suite. Understand OWASP Top 10, social engineering, and vulnerability scanning.
Defensive Security (Blue Team): Detect, monitor, and respond to threats using SIEM tools like Splunk. Dive into forensic analysis and incident response workflows.
Generative AI for Cybersecurity: Leverage ChatGPT, PentesterGPT, and other AI tools to generate test cases, automate reconnaissance, and analyze threats.
Web Security & Bug Bounty Fundamentals: Test web applications, report vulnerabilities, and participate in real-world bug bounty programs.
Real-World Projects & CTF Challenges: Practice with Capture The Flag exercises on TryHackMe and Hack The Box. Build a portfolio to show off your skills.
Career Preparation: Get support with certification planning (e.g. OSCP), freelance gig setup, and job application strategy.

topics: Threat Landscape Overview (types of threats, attacker motivations)
CIA Triad & Security Goals (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability)
Security Policies, Standards & Compliance (GDPR, ISO, NIST, etc.)

Operating Systems, Asset Management & Sy.class: Operating Systems, Asset Management & System Security
topics: Secure Boot, Trusted Execution, and privilege management
Networking Fundamentals (TCP/IP, OSI model, routing, switching)
Network Protocols & Vulnerabilities (DNS, ARP, DHCP, etc.)
Firewalls, NAT, VPNs & Secure Remote Access

Red Team Operations – Offensive Security.class: Red Team Operations – Offensive Security Tactics
topics: Exploitation Techniques (e.g. buffer overflows, injection attacks)

Blue Team Operations – Defensive Securit.class: Blue Team Operations – Defensive Security Strategies
topics: Log Management & SIEM (Security Information and Event Management)
Overview of Generative AI & LLMs in Security
Automating Defensive Tasks with AI (e.g., alert classification, log summarization)
Risks & Ethical Considerations of AI in Security
Integrating AI Tools into Security Operations

Web Application Security & Bug Bounty Hu.class: Web Application Security & Bug Bounty Hunting
topics: Web Protocols & OWASP Top Ten (e.g. Injection, XSS, CSRF)
Secure Coding Practices (input validation, sessions, authentication)
Testing Tools & Methods (burp suite, scanners, manual testing)

Capture the Flag (CTF) Challenges & Prac.class: Capture the Flag (CTF) Challenges & Practical Labs
topics: Setting up Lab Environments (VMs, containers, networks)
Common CTF Categories (crypto, reverse engineering, web, binary exploitation)
Team Strategy & Time Management in CTFs
OSINT Tools & Techniques (search engines, social media profiling, metadata, domain research)
Designing a Full Security Project (from planning to documentation)
Simulating Red vs Blue Exercises / Attack vs Defense Scenarios
Building a Security Portfolio (reports, labs, CTF wins)
Resume & LinkedIn Tailoring for Cybersecurity Roles
